name: ck3tiger-for-vscode
description: Helps you make mods for Crusader Kings 3 using Amtep's Tiger tool (previously ck3-tiger)

commands.title: ck3tiger: Get problems from the log file (without running ck3tiger)

ck3tiger.tigerPath.markdownDescription: Specifies location of your ck3tiger instance

ck3tiger.ck3Path.description: The location of a vanilla CK3 installation (like "C:/Program Files (x86)/Steam/steamapps/common/Crusader Kings III/game"

ck3tiger.modPath.description: The location of your .mod file (like "Like Documents/Paradox Interactive/Crusader Kings III/mod/<.mod file>"

ck3tiger.minConfidence.title: Minimum confidence level
markdownEnumDescriptions: *strong* for confidence that the problem is real.
ck3tiger.minConfidence.markdownDescription:
The minimum confidence level for a problem to be reported.

Confidence is how sure the validator is about a problem.

- *weak* for likely false positives.
- *reasonable* for most messages.
- *strong* for confidence that the problem is real.

**weak** is the default.

ck3tiger.experimental.runOnSave.title: Run ck3tiger on file save
ck3tiger.experimental.runOnSave.markdownDescription: When enabled, automatically runs ck3tiger validation when a file is saved within the mod directory.

ck3tiger.experimental.patterns.title: File patterns to detect changes
ck3tiger.experimental.patterns.markdownDescription: A glob pattern for files to run ck3tiger on when a file is saved within the mod directory.

ck3tiger.openPreviousLogOnStartup.title: Open previous log on startup
ck3tiger.openPreviousLogOnStartup.markdownDescription: When enabled, automatically generates problems from the previous log file on startup.

ck3tiger.checkUpdatesOnStartup.title: Check for updates on startup
ck3tiger.checkUpdatesOnStartup.markdownDescription: When enabled, automatically checks for ck3tiger updates when the extension starts.

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
